title: INTERSPEECH_2008_28_abs

sentences.text: A critical step in encoding sound for neuronal processing occurs when the analog pressure wave is coded into discrete nerve-action potentials .

Recent pool models of the inner hair cell synapse do not reproduce the dead time period after an intense stimulus , so we used visual inspection and automatic speech recognition -LRB- ASR -RRB- to investigate an offset adaptation -LRB- OA -RRB- model proposed by Zhang et al. -LSB- 1 -RSB- .
OA improved phase locking in the auditory nerve -LRB- AN -RRB- and raised ASR accuracy for features derived from AN fibers -LRB- ANFs -RRB- .
We also found that OA is crucial for auditory processing by onset neurons -LRB- ONs -RRB- in the next neuronal stage , the auditory brainstem .
Multi-layer perceptrons -LRB- MLPs -RRB- performed much better than standard Gaussian mixture models -LRB- GMMs -RRB- for both our ANF-based and ON-based auditory features .
Similar results were previously obtained with MSG -LRB- Modulation-filtered Spec-troGram -RRB- auditory features -LSB- 2 -RSB- .
Thus we believe researchers working with novel features should consider trying MLPs .

Entity-the_analog_pressure_wave.description: The analog pressure wave refers to an acoustic signal, specifically the mechanical compression and rarefaction of air particles in sound waves, which is converted into electrical signals by sensory hair cells in the inner ear.

summary: A critical step in encoding sound for neuronal processing occurs when the analog pressure wave is coded into discrete nerve-action potentials . Recent pool models of the inner hair cell synapse do not reproduce the dead time period after an intense stimulus , so we used visual inspection and automatic speech recognition -LRB- ASR -RRB- to investigate an offset adaptation -LRB- OA -RRB- model proposed by Zhang et al. -LSB- 1 -RSB- . OA improved phase locking in the auditory nerve -LRB- AN -RRB- and raised ASR accuracy for features derived from AN fibers -LRB- ANFs -RRB- . We also found that OA is crucial for auditory processing by onset neurons -LRB- ONs -RRB- in the next neuronal stage , the auditory brainstem . Multi-layer perceptrons -LRB- MLPs -RRB- performed much better than standard Gaussian mixture models -LRB- GMMs -RRB- for both our ANF-based and ON-based auditory features . Similar results were previously obtained with MSG -LRB- Modulation-filtered Spec-troGram -RRB- auditory features -LSB- 2 -RSB- . Thus we believe researchers working with novel features should consider trying MLPs .

Predicate-is_coded_into.label: is coded into
Predicate-is_coded_into.description: The predicate 'is coded into' indicates a relationship where the subject (a signal or information) is transformed or represented in a specific way, resulting in the object. This transformation can involve simplification, abstraction, or conversion of one form to another, such that the original content is preserved but its representation changes.

Predicate-occurs_when.label: occurs when
Predicate-occurs_when.description: The predicate 'occurs when' indicates a temporal relationship between the subject and object. It specifies that an event or situation described by the subject takes place at the moment, time period, or condition defined by the object.

Predicate-do_not_reproduce.label: do not reproduce
Predicate-do_not_reproduce.description: The predicate 'do not reproduce' indicates a prohibition or inhibition on the subject's ability to replicate or generate something in relation to the object. It suggests that there is no possibility of the subject producing, creating, or generating anything related to the object during this specific context.

Predicate-is_crucial_for.label: is crucial for
Predicate-is_crucial_for.description: The predicate 'is crucial for' indicates a relationship where the subject plays an essential or vital role in achieving, facilitating, or enabling the object. It suggests that the subject is necessary or indispensable for the object to function properly, operate effectively, or achieve its intended purpose.

Predicate-than.label: than
Predicate-than.description: The predicate 'than' indicates a comparison or contrast between two entities. It suggests that the subject and object have distinct characteristics, properties, or behaviors, with the subject being compared to or differing from the object.

Predicate-should_consider_trying.label: should consider trying
Predicate-should_consider_trying.description: The predicate 'should consider trying' indicates that the subject (e.g. researchers) ought to evaluate or explore the object (e.g. MLPs), potentially adopting a new approach, method, or technology.

Predicate-improved.label: improved
Predicate-improved.description: The predicate 'improved' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject has enhanced or optimized the process or outcome described by the object.

Predicate-occurs.label: occurs
Predicate-occurs.description: The predicate 'occurs' indicates a relationship of happening or taking place between the subject and object. It suggests that the action described by the subject (e.g., auditory processing) involves, results from, or is accompanied by the process or state denoted by the object (e.g., encoding sound for neuronal processing).

Predicate-is_crucial.label: is crucial
Predicate-is_crucial.description: The predicate 'is crucial' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the action or process described by the subject has significant importance for achieving, maintaining, or understanding the state or outcome represented by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) is related to its more general category or classification, which is represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject can be subsumed under or falls within the scope of the object.
